Would recommend to anyone visiting Flagstaff!

review_text: Rachelle place was great as my base during my visit to the Grand Canyon, Sedona, and local Flagstaff nature! Her place had lots of very useful amenities (from laundry to kitchen equipment) that i felt comfortable using. The neighbourhood is nice and quiet and peaceful. There is some public transportation available (a somewhat direct bus from downtown to Rachelle, albeit ending with a 5 min uphill walk). Other guests were staying in rooms close to mine, bathroom was next door, and I frequently interacted with members of the family that live at the house. It felt very homey and I was able to ask questions and get help quickly whenever i needed to. Would definitely recommend Rachelle's place to anyone needing a stopover or a base for exploring the surrounding nature :)

review_text: This Airbnb is a fun themed getaway! We enjoyed our time in "wonderland ". We had the extra pleasure of experiencing the unique decor in the snow! There was a delicious assortment of teas and a plethora of teapots to steep our tea. Thank you for the banana nut muffin mix. We encourage you to emphasize your rule of no more than four people on the premises at any time in your online description. There is a suggestion of a tea party for 6 and the table is set for eight with eight chairs and service for eight. There isn't a place to store the china while you eat. It is a very fun and comfortable place to celebrate the nuances of Alice's wonderland. We only wish we could have shared it with two more members of our family.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: We recently stayed 3 nights here. The house is definitely unique & the inside is as described. The location was great as it was within 10-15 minutes to Downtown Flag, right across the street from hiking & just a few minutes from two dog parks for our pup. It was easy to locate with directions provided & using navigation. The house is on the older side but they have done a great job keeping things fresh & clean. The main issue we had was the yard area. It was very overgrown & neglected with weeds. For instance, the listing points out the firepit, but as it is now it would not be safe to start a fire due to the weeds. There were also gaps in the fence where a smaller dog could get out. We ended up blocking those off with things from the yard. In the current state, we didn't feel comfortable allowing our pup to be outside unattended. The outside area needs immediate attention. We realize Airbnb rankings are strict, but after talking through it we could not give it 5 stars based on this.

Mainly booked this to have a hot tub. 1st night the hot tub ended up irritating our skin (itchy & red bumps) & completely bleaching my bathing suit. When I brought it up to the host, she didnâ€™t show any concern & said someone will clean it the next day. We didnâ€™t hear anything until I messaged again at 5pm the next day about it. Then she sent someone. Turns out the previous guest before us dumped a WHOLE bottle of chlorine into it. He said heâ€™s never seen that much in a hot tub & had to drain it multiple times. Seems irresponsible to leave it up to a guest to put chlorine in the hot tub without checking it for the next guest.
On another note, the house was okay but could use some updating. The showers were old & the floors were really creaky. Also the home is right off a busy street. Some of the windows didnâ€™t have any curtains to make it private at night so it did make us a lil nervous at times when it was dark. I feel like the pictures donâ€™t capture the home well.

Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
5 star review for the overall theme. We loved all the decor and little touches to follow with the Mad Hatter Theme! There was great communication with the host and check in and out was very easy. The location, while on a busy highway was fine for us. There was a lot of ambulance and helicopter sounds at night, I imagine it must be close to a hospital?
We didn't didn't find the dog friendly accommodations until the last night we left as we didn't open and search the closets until we were looking for an extra bath towel. But that's probably our fault for not being nosey LOL. An outside trash receptacle for doggie waste bags would have been convenient too, if there was one we didn't see it.
Again we really loved all the decor and the whole experience. There were some burnt out lightbulbs and the outside tables and hot tub cover were very dusty/dirty. We had to wipe them off to be able to use the outside table. We didn't use the hot tub while there due to the strong chemical smell when we lifted the cover. I know to expect that but it was a lot stronger than i'm normally used to and we opted not to use it. And just little things like burnt out lightbulbs, stickey counters and only 2 tissues in the tissue box. We did look through the kitchen cabinets for additional kleenex but didn't see any. Again nothing huge just small minor things.
We were going to have a "tea" party but the only tea flavor that we really liked (Cherry Blossom) only had 2 bags and my mom hogged them for herself. We did really like the brand and flavor though and ordered some off Amazon to enjoy at home! It was also advertised in the listing that cookies were provided for the tea party experience but there were none that we could find. There was an empty bowl on the county when we arrived, which based on other pictures we've seen is where the cookies would have been.
Overall a really nice experience and it was a great place to stop in our travels for a couple days to get some personal work done for my remote job and to get a break from the car.
Thanks for such a unique experience!

review_text: What a magical fun place and great experience all around! We enjoyed our visit so much, such fun, creativity, and attention to detail. Instead of a run-of-the-mill place to stay, The Mad Hatter and Alice in Wonderland theme throughout adds a special touch. Jen has thought of everything in putting her place together and is ready to help with information or whatever comes up. We enjoyed it all -- dinner at the elaborate tea party table, a hot soak in the spa, a round of croquet by the "flower bed", a swing on the swing, playing the piano, a game of chess using massive chess pieces, even a romp in the master bedroom under the decorated ceiling and ornate mirrors. The location was perfect for our visit to Flagstaff. Looking forward to another stay. Highly recommend!

Rating, 2 stars

,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Aside from the unique decor, this house has nothing else to offer. Our family had an awful time and cut our reservation short and left early, because it was an awful stay.
Backyard is full of weeds. I understand monsoon and rain season in Flagstaff. More of a reason to have landscaping more often to prepare for this. Broken mirrors outside making it dangerous for our dog and children.
The two rooms upstairs are a joke. The room with the hammock is so small that you literally can't even move. The other bedroom just fits a queen size bed.
Lots of loud road noise because the house is literally on the highway. The air conditioners are extremely loud and do not reach the master downstairs.
The couch by the front door was in awful condition full of stains, hair and other nasty particles. The landlord said that she was replacing the couch one hour prior to our arrival, which made it inconvenient for her because we arrived a bit early. It will take much longer than an hour to get the large couch out of the house and the new couch inside for our arrival.
When I reached out to the host to help with our concerns, she was very rude and dismissive. She stated that she can't control my expectations. Our family was just looking for a safe and fun house and this place was definitely not the one.

If you are going through Flagstaff and looking for a fun time whether with friends or family this is a one-of-a-kind fun experience and not to be missed!

review_text: This place was magical from the start! We spent about 15 minutes exploring the outside of the house before we even entered! Every detail inside and out brought a smile to our faces. My daughter LOVED sleeping in the hammock! Jen was so responsive and clearly cares about her guests. We were visiting Flagstaff and the Grand Canyon area to decompress after a funeral and Jen was so sweet to offer condolences and make sure we enjoyed our stayâ€¦the host from Airbnb we stayed at for the funeral didnâ€™t even do that! If you have the chance to visit this crazy, magical, MAD place, you MUST!

name: Amber
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The new standard against which all AirBnB's will be judged! This place is overflowing with creative touches and fun amenities: old-timey record player that my husband enjoyed, harpsichord on which my son happily played "ominous music," popcorn, pancake mix, a wall you can write and draw on, a hammock my son loved sleeping in, hot tub, croquet, and so much more to discover. We did not find anything we could possibly have asked Jen for or about, but I'm confident if we needed her, she would've been quick to respond and help out. It's near the Safeway for groceries (my husband walked there) and there's a nice little pueblo ruin (Elden Pueblo) up the street. Follow Jen's directions to find it; Google will steer you wrong. Minor caveats that might apply to specific people: It's right off the highway, so if you are very sensitive to that kind of noise you might be unhappy. There's a lot of china around, so if you have roughhousing kids that could be a challenge. The stairs to the attic bedrooms are weird and steep, so people with limited mobility or clumsy toddlers might struggle--but the master bedroom is downstairs.

Jenna had some recommended eateries, so we tried out the eatery at 3 Beaver St and had the best breakfast, then headed across the street to the bagel shop for the next morning's breakfast. Everything is within 15 minutes and easy to get to. We were in Flag about three years ago and discovered a wood carver who makes bears of every size and eagles, etc. He was only 15 minutes away, so we went over and bought another wood-carved bear and an eagle. I love trains! And about a quarter mile away are the train tracks, not so loud as to be bothersome, but a wonderful backdrop. This place is just off the freeway. VERY CLEAN!

review_text: This is a brand new remodel with all modern amenities. It is on a working ranch, so that is pretty fun. There was a round-up while we were there, so we got to visit with the owner's family. They were non-instrusive but welcomed this interaction that occurred at our instigation. I have been an interior designer for over 20 years, and this little home as ALL the designer touches. This was perhaps the cleanest Airbnb I have ever rented with lots of thoughtful perks such as local whole bean coffee with grinder, tea and hot pot for water, and any bathroom supply you might possibly forget to pack. I would definitely choose this location again! The only small negative is that it is located close to the freeway and train tracks. However, once inside the house, there was not any noise problem. Chaparral pines seclude the home and provide great privacy. The host was very responsive when we reached out.

review_text: The Thundercliffe lodge is perfect; nestled at the edge of a meadow and surrounded by national forest, it is the perfect peaceful place to enjoy family time together and appreciate nature. The lodge itself is so thoughtfully decorated and comfortable that you feel like you are staying at a friend's well-appointed home; I especially loved the cozy little reading nooks that were perfect for relaxing with a good book. The kitchen had lots of supplies, and in addition to the well-appointed interior, there are great places to hang out outside on the front patio and an outdoor fire pit. The location is great, too; nice hiking nearby, and less than an hour from the south rim of the Grand Canyon, Wupatki and Sunset Crater N.M.s, and lots of good restaurants in Flagstaff only 15 minutes away. We would love to come back another time soon! :)

I was there with my family on a working trip and was unable to do any work and I didnt have any cell service either with at&t. We also didnt know until check in that we had to remove all the bedding and towels and put them in the laundry or do the dishes etc. Just please be more transparent and honest and have a little more quick customer service going forward. I will however not be staying there again.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Chris's cabin is wonderful - we really can't recommend it enough. It's even more charming than the photos suggest, and our family declared it one of the best places we've stayed!
After a couple of nights in hotels on our trip around National Parks, this cabin felt like an oasis - and with a huge washer and dryer and plenty of hot water (despite being an off grid cabin), it really allowed us the chance to clean up and recharge. Even though it's a 2 bedroom there was plenty of room to spread out. And although we were there during snow so didn't get a chance to use the outside spaces - I can only imagine how nice it would be to sit on the covered front porch in slightly warmer weather and take in the amazing view.
Chris was so welcoming and helpful and genuinely a super host.
(One thing to mention - the upstairs 2nd bedroom is accessed by a spiral staircase which is totally stable and secure, but just something to be aware of if your group has really little ones or anyone who is a little unsteady on their feet.)
This really is a perfect cabin - highly, highly recommend!!

It is close to Grand Canyon, numerous trails and places to explore in the Coconino and Kaibab National Forests, and it is a short trip back to Flagstaff for supplies or just to visit Flag.
While there is wi-fi, it is way off the grid so don't come expecting highspeed broadband. Email and web surfing is fine. Streaming is spotty. But you didn't come out here to stay inside and watch Netflix did you?

Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Amazing place! This property is very cool. The main house has plenty of room for several guests. The downstairs bed is very large and comfortable. The bathroom has double sinks and a really neat stone shower/bath. Super comfy bedding and towels. The kitchen had everything we needed and the grill was great. We loved the extra large table outside for dining al fresco. The couches in the living room were nice. The dÃ©cor is amazing. A couple of our kids used the pull out couch to sleep on. The upstairs bed is good size and the bathroom is pretty nice with a standup shower.
We didnâ€™t need to use the 2nd cabin but it had enough room for another couple. The yurt also looked like a fun place to stay. The property is well maintained and has a koi fish pond. There was a thunderstorm and we saw a huge double rainbow afterward. We had planned to make a fire outside but didnâ€™t have time with all the fun stuff to do in the area. We ate at a few restaurants downtown and all were wonderful. We visited Bearizona which was less than an hour away and a really neat lava park not too far away â€“ Sunset Crater Volcano. We definitely recommend this place. Chris was very nice!

name: Brittany
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
July 2017
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: First, the scenery at this place is amazing. My Wife and 3.5-year-old Son shared this place with two other couples. One couple had a 1.5-year-old, and the other couple had an eight and nine-year-old plus an infant. My Wife and I got there early and were met by the owner's Wife. She was super nice, and gave a good run-down on the place. We were initially a little surprised when she told us her Son and FiancÃ© were staying in the cabin directly next to the main cabin and another family was staying in the Yurt. Not a huge deal, but it might be a deal breaker for other renters to know that the owner's Son is literally staying in a cabin about 25 feet away. I would inquire about this if you are interested in this rental property. In terms of the sleeping situation. The main cabin has a king bed in the master bedroom with a full-bath. The living room has a pull-out sofa about the size of a twin bed. Upstairs has a queen bed, and a pull-out sofa which is also about the the size of a twin bed. Upstairs has a full bathroom. The main cabin is nice. The kitchen had everything we needed. Moths/insects/flies were a bit of an issue, but the place is completely off the grid so it did not bother anyone. Downstairs in the main cabin it was easy to regulate temperature with the windows/verbal instructions the owner provided. However, upstairs was significantly warmer than downstairs, and it was borderline uncomfortable to take a nap upstairs and fall asleep at night. A fan upstairs is highly recommended. We stayed from 31 June - 4 July. The Wi-Fi worked great, but we never tested out the television. However, the main cabin did have some sort of satellite service. I would also inquire about the washer and dryer. The owner did not mention it, but the 9-year-old seemed to find his way past the locked door in the master bedroom where he discovered a utility room of sort with a washer and dryer. The outdoor patio was one of our favorite parts about the main cabin. During the day, and in the evening, it was great. There is a nice Weber grill and furniture to sit about 8 people. The other cabin was also neat, but is just a place to sleep. If I remember here is a queen or full bed plus a another twin size bed. There is no bathroom or shower in this cabin. Again the other cabin was occupied by the Owner's Son, and the Yurt was occupied by another family. The Owner's do not allow pets, however the other two couples we shared the place with brought their dogs. I told the owner this shortly after we arrived as soon as I found out the animals were coming. Understandably I could tell she was not pleased, but she was very understanding and allowed the two dogs to stay...

name: Elizabeth
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2017
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Thundercliffe Lodge is an authentic rustic yet immensely comfortable cabin nestled into the forest surrounding the highest mountain peaks of Arizona. Even in June snowy patches could be seen on Mt Humphrey. The location is superb for day trips to the Grand Canyon, Williams' Train Depot, Mystic Sedona, Native American ruins, and forest hikes galore. Only 20 minutes to downtown Flagstaff is a historic district of quaint shops with everything from handcrafts to luxury artworks. Our first night we had fish & chips at Collinâ€™s Irish Pub, another night fine dining on linen tablecloths at Josephineâ€™s Bistro. There are several microbreweries all within a walking distance, so pack comfortable shoes. However, you may never want to leave the lodge as it has everything to enjoy a respite in nature, the smell of pines, wildflowers and pond all attract deer, rabbits, birds (from hummingbirds to raptures) no binocular required; they are that close. Chris was an amazing host, friendly, accommodating and informative. He had recommendations to hikes off the beaten path with tips only locals know. An exciting plus for me was actually finding all 13 spices/ingredients right in the cabinet to make traditional Chai tea on the stove! Nothing beats sipping a warm drink from a pottery mug watching sunrise and set sitting on bent willow furniture in the middle of Thundercliffeâ€™s ten acres. We loved it and hope to visit again.

review_text:
Rich's place is the best!
It is extremely dog friendly. The small fenced in yard is amazing for dogs and offers peace of mind to let them roam around. Rich made a convenient blanket for the couch as well to protect the furniture.
Location is convenient! Super close to downtown. 15 min walk to all bars and restaurants or a $5 uber ride if you aren't up for walking.
Kitchen is great! Water temp and pressure in shower is great! WiFi is quick! Heating works amazing to keep you warm on cold nights!
Rich answers super quick if you have any questions.
The mattresses are very firm so if you can't sleep without a pillowy soft mattress, keep that in mind.
Amazing stay! This will be our place when we come back to Flagstaff!

review_text:
We absolutely loved this Airbnb space. It was pristinely clean and located conveniently to walk to all the downtown Flagstaff attractions, or branch out to drive to the hiking trails and National Parks. It had a nice fenced space to let the dog out, with a fire ring to enjoy the crisp evenings by. The compact kitchen was well appointed with cooking supplies and even had spices & storage containers - a bonus for us, as we love to cook family-style meals together on vacation. The cozy bedrooms had super-comfy, firm beds. We appreciated the efficient use of space, including the full laundry facilities.

Additionally, any questions we had for the owner were answered within the hour. We would definitely come back to this Airbnb.

review_text:
Great place to stay and hang out for a group or family of 2 to 4. The kids especially enjoyed the coziness of the place.
Street parking is free. Luckily, the parking space described in Trevor's instructions was available throughout our stay, as I had been told that there are no designated parking areas for each home.
Amenities and essential materials such as dishes, cutlery, bath soap, shampoo, tissue, paper towels, laundry soap, and dishwashing liquid were available to use. The beds were very comfortable, and the sheets were really clean. Having gameboards available was a plus for family game night. There is no air conditioning, but the electric fans were sufficient, given the relatively cooler temperatures at Flagstaff even during summer.
Overall, it's a great place to stay and return to in Flagstaff.

review_text: The house is a great value for the buck. The house was clean and beds comfy. The space fits 5 perfectly. The outdoor space is cozy. The heater works excellent. The shower is small but has nice pressure and heat. There is no longer a graveled area to park. Bring golashes for rainy weather and snowboots during snow. Trevor might update the photos to show an updated exterior. The front door faces an unpaved alleyway and the red dirt is no one's friend. Trevor provides nice mats to act as a mudroom, a snow shovel and broom to keep things tidy. A grocery store is less then a mile, as is La Fonda, best Mexican eats in town. I truly enjoyed my week stay at Trevor's place. As i have family in the area, I will rent again.

name: Raj

Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
December 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Good -
1) The place has all the amenities and the host placed lot of attention to smaller details.
2)Bathroom was clean and well equipped; shampoo/shower gel weren't cheap ones.
3) Bed/Mattress/comforters/pillow was very comfortable (again not the cheap spring mattresses).
4) Kitchen was very clean with plenty of dishware/pots/pans etc.
5) Kids enjoyed board games, darts and cornhole. TVs has popular streaming services (youtube, netflix, prime) which was quite handy.
Not so good - Using the alley for getting in/out was horrible. As the snow melted, the alley became quite slippery (it may be due to construction next door) and we almost fell. Parking the car across the street didn't feel safe (especially since Sunnyside is not in the best part of the town). The house is small for a family of four (especially the shower).

name: Julie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Trevor's place is comfortable and well equipped, with lots of thoughtful stuff included--Q-tips, hair elastics, coffee filters, and a generous supply of little coffee creamers, among other things. The kitchen area is huge. Trevor is a very responsive host. The location is convenient--access to the Arizona Trail is right across the street, Safeway is only a few minutes away, and downtown is about a 10-minute drive. The neighborhood is quiet. A few things to keep in mind: the shower is very small, parking is on the street (although there is plenty of space to park), and the driveway/alleyway that leads to the door can be icy and/or muddy. I've stayed here twice now, in summer and winter, and would definitely stay again. It's often the best Airbnb deal in town, from what I've seen.

I only mention it for travelers who are especially noise sensitive -- or who, like me, sometimes get a little startled by new voices/sounds when traveling solo. All in all, I had a really great stay, and would recommend this spot to anyone!

Another thing was the heater would shut off every night in the middle of the night. It would get very cold and my baby would wake up in the middle of the night crying. The temperature would drop 10-15 degrees colder than the temperature we had set it to before bed. We would have to get up and reset the thermostat so the heater would kick on. Other than that it was a great clean home and was close to a lot of great restaurants and grocery stores.

name: Jonathan
rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
Â·
September 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Unfortunately I can't leave the 5 star review that I think this spot likely typically deserves.
We were initially very impressed and pleased with the space as it is cute, private, and just has that quality feel you'd expect with a nicer hotel room. However, later in our stay it became unequivocally obvious that the bed linens were not changed or washed prior to our arrival. The sheets presented as generally clean, however, after closer inspection it was obvious that there were loose body hairs and other debris on the surface of the fabric. We thought perhaps the hairs and debris we embedded from the wash machine but that was clearly not the case. The host apologized and helped resolve the issue, but unfortunately the issue is too egregious to leave a positive review. Obviously we don't know if this issue was simply a gross oversight of the cleaner or a result of intentional negligence, but nonetheless dirty linens is not acceptable at any establishment and greatly diminished the enjoyment of our evening.
Providing the host takes corrective steps to ensure this particular oversight does not happen again it would certainly be a great addition to anyone's itinerary.

name: Ashley
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
1 week ago
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: What a fantastic home with such an incredible host. This A-frame cabin in the woods just south of Flag is everything that is promised and so much more. The views, the coziness, the feeling of remoteness with accessibility, the accommodations, the consideration, the price, the cleanness - all FIVE STARS!! Andrew's awesome about responding to questions within an hour, and he's thought of everything for the house. All supplies were well-stocked, and my husband and I wanted for nothing. Just when we thought we had Andrew stumped, we found the coffee grinder after accidentally buying beans instead of ground coffee. (And that's only if you want your own - there are two coffee makers with more than enough coffee for both.) The house is SO clean with a ton of furnishings, blankets and pillows. Streaming TVs available and easy to use. You can trust that everything in the description and photos is true - in fact, it's a little understated. This cabin experience was nothing short of magical.

name: Brianna
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
2 weeks ago
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Absolutely loved it! The kitchen is a dream with staples like oil, honey, hot chocolate (a must-have!), half and half, sugar, and two types of coffee machines. Every appliance you could need for breakfast or dinner is here, plus the cutest retro Galanz fridge and microwave, and top-of-the-line appliances. The decor is cozy yet modern industrial, featuring an old-time typewriter and metal shelving packed with games. Clever little blocks display WiFi codes and curated Spotify playlists for the Marshall Bluetooth speaker. Privacy is well thought out with an upstairs curtain and a downstairs accordion door. The bathroom had plenty of hot water, fluffy towels, and nice soap dispensers. Little tree faces and mushroom path lights add a whimsical touch to the clean and well-maintained home. Perfectly situated close to town for convenience, yet far enough for peace and privacy. Can't wait to stay here again!
Communication with the host was fantastic. They were responsive and exceptional!

review_text:
During our recent stay at Trevor's place, we were thoroughly impressed. We were a group of three, and our primary objective was to work remotely while enjoying a comfortable and tranquil environment during a tour of NAU.
Trevor's property exceeded our expectations in a few ways. First is, its location. Nestled against a quarry, the property had no rear neighbors, ensuring complete privacy and a peaceful atmosphere. The neighboring properties on either side were quiet, contributing to a sense of serenity.
What set this place apart was its location in a safe neighborhood, free from any disruptive car or train noises. This allowed us to focus on our work during the day and enjoy restful nights. The inclusion of a mudroom and a decent backyard were practical and appreciated additions, offering convenience and outdoor relaxation.
The beds were comfortable, and the property was equipped with nearly everything we needed for our stay. Thanks, Trevor!

review_text: Our spring break camping plans fell through due to the floods so we booked this place last minute to play in the snow. Everything was great! There was a little quarry/hill behind the house that the kids liked to climb. It was tucked away in a quiet neighborhood but only a short drive (or walk) to a shopping center with grocery store. It was nice to have a garage to keep the car in so I didn't have to dig it out of snow. We definitely saved this place for our next trek up north from Phoenix. The host was very responsive and helpful but only needed to reach out a couple of times since everything was set up and laid out very nicely.
